items.title: An Intrepid trip inspired me to uproot my life and move to Morocco
items.excerpt: Travel had always brought Nancy joy, but a recent trip brought her a whole lot more – including an across-the-world move and a complete career change.

items.title: Home and Travel: Why You Can’t Appreciate One Without the Other
items.excerpt: I used to think “home” was a dirty word. Out there — on the road — was where life happened, full of exciting adventures, fascinating people, and endless possibilities. No dreary commutes, 30-minute lunch breaks, mind-numbing meetings, or endless lists of to-dos squeezed into a…

items.title: Menu of dreams: My perfect day of dishes from around the world
items.excerpt: When I travel to a new country, my favourite way to connect with its culture is through its food – not just what’s on the plate, but the stories behind it.

items.title: American Express® Business Gold Card Review
Our US national parks need protection: Here’s why Intrepid is stepping up
items.excerpt: An open letter to our community.

items.title: Cabinet of cure-alls: Remedies from around the globe
items.excerpt: Headaches, motion sickness, sunburns, bug bites and tummy troubles can find us anywhere in the world. And even if you’ve packed yourself a first-aid kit with a pill for everything and a band-aid for anything, if you ask around you might just find just the local panacea (or pla…

items.title: Meeting Costa Rica’s Maleku tribe deepened my respect for Mother Nature
items.excerpt: Costa Rica is a nature lover’s dream. But on a journey through Costa Rica, Jemma Fowler realises that nature, and the indigenous communities that rely upon it, need more than love and appreciation. They need respect and, more importantly, environmental action.
